properties.areaDesc: Eastern Mojave Desert, Including the Mojave National Preserve; Morongo Basin; Northwest Plateau; Owens Valley; Southern Clark County; Esmeralda and Central Nye County; Las Vegas Valley; Spring Mountains-Red Rock Canyon; Lake Mead National Recreation Area; White Mountains of Inyo County; Lincoln County; Western Clark and Southern Nye County; Death Valley National Park; Northwest Deserts; Lake Mead National Recreation Area; Eastern Sierra Slopes of Inyo County; Western Mojave Desert; Northeast Clark County; Sheep Range
properties.headline: High Wind Watch issued February 1 at 2:47AM PST until February 3 at 6:00PM PST by NWS Las Vegas NV
properties.description:
* WHAT...West to southwest winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60
mph possible Sunday afternoon and evening, followed by northwest
to north winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 60 mph possible
Sunday night and Monday.

* WHERE...Portions of northwest Arizona, southeast California
and south central and southern Nevada.

* WHEN...From Sunday afternoon through Monday afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines.
Widespread power outages are possible. Travel could be
difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Temporary
outdoor structures, such as tents, could be blown away.
properties.instruction:
Monitor the latest forecasts and warnings for updates on this
situation. Fasten loose objects or shelter objects in a safe
location prior to the onset of winds. Consider moving outdoor
plans indoors.

NWSheadline: HIGH WIND WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON
